Removing duplicate atoms from structures

Aug 20, 2020

Sometimes structures contain duplicate atomsâ€¦I learned the hard way. I was recently running some calculations and was getting errors like WARNING: CNORMN: search vector ill defined. Additionally, I was finding that changing ALGO to All was producing the same error, leading to my conclusion that I likely had a problematic structure. Using , you can quickly check if a structure contains duplicate atoms.

from pymatgen.core.structure import Structure
s = Structure.from_file('POSCAR')
print(s.is_valid())

With that said and to the best of my knowledge, doesnâ€™t have a method for removing duplicate atoms. For that, I turned to , is a tool to convert and manipulate atomic data files. has an option for removing duplicate atoms (https://atomsk.univ-lille.fr/doc/en/option_rmd.html); itâ€™s really easy to use and it works great! What worked for me was

atomsk POSCAR -rmd 0.2 pos

which gave

Bye bye duplicate atoms!
